title: Electric potential - at point P from 2q and -q

content.question: Two particles are located near Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. One particle has charge <math alttext="positive 2 q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math> and is a distance <math alttext="2 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></math> to the left of Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, and the other particle has charge <math alttext="negative q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math> and is a distance <math alttext="3 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>d</mi></math> to the right of Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>. What is the electric potential at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> due to the two particles?

choices.label: <math alttext="positive two thirds k times the fraction q over d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mi>q</mi><mi>d</mi></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="positive four thirds k times the fraction q over d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mi>q</mi><mi>d</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the positive fraction 7 over 18, end fraction, times k, times the fraction with numerator q, and denominator d squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>7</mn><mn>18</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mi>q</mi><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the positive fraction 11 over 18, end fraction, times k, times the fraction with numerator q, and denominator d squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>11</mn><mn>18</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mi>q</mi><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="positive two thirds k times the fraction q over d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mi>q</mi><mi>d</mi></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
